meanings.definition: Make (something) ineffective by applying an opposite force or effect.
meanings.sent1: The superhero neutralised the villain's powers with a special device.
meanings.sent2: The antivirus software neutralised the threat posed by the malicious program.
meanings.sent3: The magician neutralised the dangerous spell by casting a counter-charm.
meanings.sent4: The scientist neutralised the acidity of the solution with a base compound.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter neutralised the spreading flames with a blast of water.

meanings.definition: Treat (a substance) so as to remove its toxic or harmful properties.
meanings.sent1: The water treatment plant neutralised the pollutants before releasing the water back into the river.
meanings.sent2: The antidote neutralised the venom of the snake bite, saving the hiker's life.
meanings.sent3: The chef neutralised the bitterness of the dish by adding a hint of sweetness.
meanings.sent4: The doctor neutralised the acidity in the patient's stomach with an alkaline solution.
meanings.sent5: The gardener neutralised the soil's high acidity by adding lime to balance it.

meanings.definition: Make (someone) unable to act in a particular way.
meanings.sent1: The hypnotist neutralised the volunteer's ability to speak during the performance.
meanings.sent2: The security guard neutralised the intruder by swiftly disarming him.
meanings.sent3: The comedian neutralised the heckler's disruptive comments with a clever comeback.
meanings.sent4: The referee neutralised the player's aggressive behavior by issuing a warning.
meanings.sent5: The teacher neutralised the student's defiance by calmly addressing the issue.
